articles.headline: Crowds gathered in Bournemouth town centre to show solidarity with the Iranian community

story_classification.reasoning: Hard news story about political protest. Requires institutional context about Iranian civil unrest. Standard reporting with quoted sources.

beat_context.reasoning: Civil unrest/political protest beat. Not inherently gendered - protests involve people of all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Anonymous Protester
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Protester directly participating in solidarity demonstration. They ARE part of the story - someone affected by the Iranian situation expressing their demands. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - they are a participant in the event being covered.

quoted_sources.name: Donald Trump
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Former US President providing external political commentary on Iranian protests. He is NOT part of the Bournemouth protest or directly affected - he's an international political figure offering policy statements. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? YES - any international political leader could provide similar commentary.

quoted_sources.name: Abbas Araghchi
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Iran's Foreign Minister providing government response. External authority figure representing Iranian government, not directly affected by protests. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? YES - any Iranian government official could provide official response.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Solidarity protest in Bournemouth for Iranian civil unrest

articles.headline: Ben Edgell praises Poole Town FC partnership with SEN

story_classification.reasoning: News story about community partnership. Straightforward reporting with organizational spokesperson. Not experiential narrative.

beat_context.reasoning: Community partnership/disability services beat. Not inherently gendered - SEND support involves all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Ben Edgell
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Commercial Manager of Poole Town FC - he IS part of the organization running the partnership. He's not an external expert; he's an organizational insider explaining their own initiative. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - he represents the club that IS the story.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Poole Town FC partners with SWRAC to support young people with SEND

articles.headline: Veganuary: not just a trend but a sustainable goal

story_classification.reasoning: Shorthand feature with human interest focus. Includes personal stories from long-term vegans sharing lived experiences. Observation-driven piece about veganism and sustainability with personal narratives.

beat_context.reasoning: Veganism/sustainability beat. Not inherently gendered - veganism is practiced by all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Frederica Sindici
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Owner of Mad Cucumbers restaurant - she IS the business being featured. She's not an external expert on veganism; she's a restaurant owner sharing her experience running a vegan establishment. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - she owns the specific restaurant being profiled.

quoted_sources.name: Cindy Lou
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Customer sharing personal 30+ year vegan experience. She IS experiencing the challenges/benefits of veganism firsthand. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - she's sharing lived experience, not replaceable expertise.

quoted_sources.name: Chanelle Paris
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Customer sharing personal 30+ year vegan experience. She IS experiencing veganism. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - personal lived experience narrative.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Veganuary campaign and impact of vegan diet on environment/accessibility
